body_html: I'll link in a tensorforest person shortly, but it seems like the best solution for this would be to make tf.split accept num_split == 0. The correct behavior would be to bail if the input tensor isn't empty along that dimension.
body_text: I'll link in a tensorforest person shortly, but it seems like the best solution for this would be to make tf.split accept num_split == 0.  The correct behavior would be to bail if the input tensor isn't empty along that dimension.
body: I'll link in a tensorforest person shortly, but it seems like the best solution for this would be to make `tf.split` accept `num_split == 0`.  The correct behavior would be to bail if the input tensor isn't empty along that dimension.
